main event: Several unidentified objects were observed accelerating and decelerating over the town of Milan, Michigan on multiple occasions in 1966.
interesting points: The objects were round and flat in shape, with a bulge on top, and approximately 50 feet in diameter.
The objects exhibited a 'waffle iron' pattern or surface and had blue, green, and white lights around the base.
The objects made a whistling sound when accelerating and caused car radios to go dead.
The objects were observed making lateral tilting motions, swinging from side to side, and performing vertical take-offs and landings.
The sightings lasted between 2-3 minutes to over an hour and a half, with the objects eventually flying off in different directions.
sighted object: several round, flat objects with a bulge on top
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
